items.title: Senior Database Administrator at Olo (New York, NY) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Database Administrator, System Administrator
Industry: E-Commerce, Mobile, Software Development
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: VC Funded

Job description

At Olo we develop an online food ordering platform used by many of the country’s largest restaurant chains, reaching millions of consumers. Olo is revolutionizing the customer experience at these restaurant chains, and we're looking for a talented database administrator to join our team and help achieve this vision. You'll work with a smart, passionate team dedicated to delivering amazing products using modern tools and technologies.

As part of the team you will play a significant and visible role in helping us scale one of the most advanced food ordering platforms in the market. You will collaborate with our engineering team to guide database designs and query optimizations. You will help us ensure that our databases run smoothly across both Production and Development/QA environments. You will contribute to ongoing performance monitoring, alerting, and tuning. You will help us diagnose and resolve production incidents.

This is a full-time position in our engineering team. Any member of that team may work at Olo’s headquarters in New York City’s Financial District or remotely from anywhere in the U.S. In fact, more than half of our engineering team is remote!

Requirements

  • Experience building and running a high-availability SQL Server Enterprise cluster in a 24/7 OLTP environment
  • Detailed knowledge of SQL Server features, language, and internal workings
  • Some experience monitoring and tuning PostgreSQL
  • Comfortable in the scripting language of your choice
  • Experience with data warehousing and ETL/ELT pipelines
  • Experience with large tables (billions of rows) in zero-downtime environments

Beneficial

  • Experience with Redis, ElasticSearch, AWS Redshift, AWS Athena, AWS Redshift Spectrum, or AWS DynamoDB
  • Experience with Graph databases (e.g. Neo4J)

About Olo

Olo reaches millions of consumers by powering mobile and online ordering for many of the country’s largest restaurant chains. Mobile ordering and payments is an exciting and active industry full of interesting players and yet still a relatively untapped market ripe for disruption.

We’re quite up-front about the technical challenges our business faces. Running a platform with multiple white-labeled front-ends, that maintains real-time connections into thousands of restaurants’ POS systems, and coordinates complex transactions between these and other third parties (such as payment gateways and gift card providers) is not for the faint of heart!

Olo is located at 26 Broadway in the historic Standard Oil Building, the former home of John D. Rockefeller.  We offer great benefits, such as 20 days of Paid Time Off, fully paid health, dental and vision care premiums, stock options, a generous parental leave plan, and perks like FitBits, rotating craft beers on tap in our kitchen, and food events featuring our clients' menu items (now you know why we give out FitBits!). Check out our culture map. 

Olo is an equal opportunity employer and diversity is valued at our company. All applicants receive consideration for employment. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender identity, sexual orientation, pregnancy, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Benefits

20 Days of PTO
Semi-private offices
Health, Vision & Dental coverage (you + your family)
Flexible working hours
Competitive Compensation Package
Powerful workstations
401(k) Plan
Maximum respect
Food events & monthly team events
12 week paid parental leave

items.title: Principal Engineer - Graph Database-Driven Payments Platforms at Kalles Group (Seattle, WA) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Contract
Experience level: Senior, Lead
Role: Backend Developer, Database Administrator
Industry: Cybersecurity, Retail, Technology Consulting
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Kalles Group is a Seattle Security, Business, and Technology consulting firm on a mission to redefine professional services with the human workplace.  Our subject-matter expert engagement teams are built to succeed. We align diverse career paths to bear on pressing business and technology challenges. 

Kalles Group Business and Technology Consulting is a platform for you to become someone better through your work.

Role Overview

This Kalles Group Principal Engineer, Graph Database Driven Payments Platforms will work closely with our business and technology teams to model complex database structures and data relationships, at the forefront of the innovation of retail payments technology. The Principal Engineer must have exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills and a track record of taking complex concepts and applying practical resolutions.

Key Activities

  • Lead the design, development, testing, and deployment of a graph database solution using Neo4j, OrientDB, or TitanDB. Current data management uses an Oracle RDBMS.
  • Design and change graph data models in accordance with technical and business requirements
  • Heighten for high performance, efficiency, scalability, and stability of the database
  • Describe the database architecture and development best practices

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s/Master’s Degree in Computer Science/Engineering or a related field (or equivalent experience)
  • 5-10 years of Java / Scala development
  • Solid OO Programming and OO Design knowledge
  • Knowledge in developing REST / JSON applications and multi-threaded applications
  • Robust unit/integration testing knowledge
  • Strong ability to develop code and to debug without using an IDE
  • Experience in Agile Development Methodology (Scrum/Kanban) 
  • Deep understanding in Graph languages: Cypher, Gremlin, Groovy Script
  • Past performance of delivery using graph databases such as Neo4j, TitanDB or OrientDB
  • Skilled knowledge of complex system integration projects in a cross-domain, cross-partner, multi-application, multi-sourced technology environment is preferred.
  • Prior experience with any of the following is a plus: Oracle RDBMS, Neo4j, Sisense, AllegroGraph, Oracle Spatial & Graph, Teradata Aster, ArangoDB, Graphbase, ThingSpa, Bitsy, ArangoDB, DEX Sparksee, Titan, VelocityGraph, InfoGrid Oracle NoSQL Database, OrientDB, Blazegraph, Weaver, Stardog, Sqrrl Enterprise, GraphDB, MapGraph, VertexDB, Cayley, Graph Engine, FlockDB, Apache Giraph, Horton will be a plus.

Location

Downtown Seattle - Up to 80% Remote.  Need first week on-site to meet team, and thereafter can be on-site 1 week per month, Monday-Thursday.  Travel and expenses paid.  

Compensation

160-200k + Strong Paid Holidays, Vacation, Health/Dental/Vision, 401(k)

Additional compensation considerations made for local engineers, or those willing to relocate.

What's Next?

Apply Today!  1 step application process, no hoops to jump through.

Kalles Group is an equal opportunity employer.

About Kalles Group

Kalles Group is a Seattle Security, Business, and Technology consulting firm on a mission to redefine professional services with the human workplace. Our subject-matter expert engagement teams are built to succeed, aligning diverse career paths to bear on pressing business and technology challenges as we serve as a platform to become something better through your work.

Benefits

Choice of Hardware and Equipment
Time for Side Projects
Emphasis on Work/Life Balance (40 hours, generous PTO, flex schedule)
Collaborative Work Spaces
Health, Vision, Dental --- Up to 90% of Premiums Paid ---
401(k) with Numerous Plan Choices
Work-From-Home (After 1 month, 30-50%)

items.title: Senior AWS Redshift Engineer at Clevertech () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Role: System Administrator
Industry: Software Development
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Job description

DESCRIPTION

Clevertech is looking for a Senior AWS Redshift Engineer to join our global team. We are looking for team members to help us develop world class software products for the most exclusive organizations in the world. We have been at this since 2000, and continue to grow off our best asset, our people.

You are comfortable translating functional and technical requirements into detailed architecture and design in addition to overall system architecture, scalability, reliability, and performance. You are highly experienced with large-scale data analytics and data warehousing. You are able to devise proactive solutions to project-related issues and have stellar communication skills to be able to effectively communicate and inspire trust in all stakeholders.

We will only consider candidates who have worked with petabytes of data in Redshift.

REQUIREMENTS

Clevertech looks for craftsmen developers who take ownership of their code. You can deliver quickly while being clever to avoid missteps. You have an effective positive attitude that shines as you show your care about client and colleague concerns. You are always learning and are a transparent communicator even when it is challenging. You thrive on challenging yourself daily and seek to surround yourself with like-minded individuals.

Technically, you have an excellent background with large-scale data structures, highly scalable server architectures and experience with network load balancers and network security. Familiarity with large-scale distributed server infrastructure design and development is essential in addition to being comfortable with industry best practices.

BENEFITS

Own Your Time

We are a completely remote team. That means we have a large amount of trust and a lot of flexibility. World travellers, young parents, nature lovers, and commute avoiders love working here. We are a collective of like minded people in over ten countries, and our global perspective shapes our every move.

Focused Work

You will work together on a dedicated team with your eye on one finish line at a time. Our teams are nimble and agile, and cover the technical range you would expect in world class product delivery teams. And keep your eye on the mail - we send out swag everywhere in the world and there are celebratory pictures of Clevertech socks, hoodies, and mugs all over slack.

Learn at your edges

We believe in learning and provide unique programs that improve your tech skills, leadership skills and even challenge you in personal development. CleverFridays, guest speakers, mentorship opportunities and in-depth industry exposure are all on offer here.

And of course, if you speak at a tech conference, we cover all expenses.

Recharge Time

We insist that you take recharge time. We are closed for major holidays and then require that you take at least two weeks a year to refresh.

Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team? Check out why.clevertech.biz.

Benefits

Full-Time Telecommuting
Flexible Schedules
Paid Time Off
Ability to Work with Cutting-Edge Technology
Opportunity to Work with and Learn from Top Developers
Contribute to Open Source

items.title: PHP MVC (Laravel, CakePHP) / MySQL developer at Vimbly - NYC (New York, NY) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Industry: Recreation & Leisure, Software Development / Engineering, Web Development
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Why join Vimbly?

Vimbly Technologies is a funded and profitable web 2.0 startup looking for a highly motivated, hard-hitting PHP developer to join the team.  Vimbly Technologies is a fast-paced company focused on creating custom best-in-class, high-performance solutions for enterprises spanning a variety of industries.  At Vimbly, you’ll work side-by-side with proven talent, creative intelligence, and smiley faces (with firm but non-painful handshakes) -- out of our office in the best city in the world, right across from the Empire State Building. Your work will have a direct and meaningful impact on the product. We aren't looking for another cog in the wheel. You will be given significant responsibility and independence. You will be challenged.

PHP MVC Developer

We are looking for a PHP MVC developer with a burning curiosity, passion for building great products, track record of writing maintainable code, and reputation of being reliable and efficient.  Our preferred MVC frameworks are Laravel and CakePHP.

Candidates able to join our team on-site in our office in Midtown Manhattan are highly preferred, but consideration for remote work will be given to exceptional candidates.  Please indicate your location on your application; applications without a location will be ignored.

Responsibilities

  • Work directly with leadership on implementing cutting-edge company initiatives
  • Develop scalable and robust back-end systems (e.g., payment, analytics, scheduling)
  • Work with front-end team to integrate user-facing markup into systems
  • Take ownership of multiple projects and learn new technologies over time

Benefits

  • 100% employer-covered health, dental & vision insurance
  • Unlimited vacation days (just get your work done)
  • Activity budget to try items on Vimbly -- try one, try them all!
  • Personal movie outings (you'll get more pairs of movie tickets than you're able to use -- so you'll know the contrast from a Vimbly activity!)
  • Unlimited Amazon reading budget to buy any book you please
  • Monthly social outings (Laser tag and paintball? Coming right up...)
  • Monthly massage and optional monthly manicure… except they come to you

Requirements

  • Expert-level experience with PHP and MySQL
  • Strong experience working with MVC paradigm
  • Understanding of front-end development and implementation (HTML5, CSS3, and jQuery)
  • Knowledge of Git version control
  • Exemplary attention to detail
  • Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, or equivalent

Bonus Points

  • Laravel or CakePHP
  • SASS
  • Composer
  • Track record with microservices and multi-server architectures
  • System administration in Linux and Apache
  • nginx
  • Experience with process efficiency optimization

About Vimbly - NYC

Founded in 2011, Vimbly is a funded web 2.0 startup that lets users find and book recreational activities for free. Our mission is to eliminate hours of research for thousands of activities like tango lessons, intro photography classes, or Italian cooking sessions. All the information is in one place instead of the usual process of Googling, picking nearby locations, checking prices, manually comparing schedules (which are each presented differently), and then exchanging emails to lock it down.

The Vimbly team is a diverse, smart and energetic group of problem solvers.  We are each experts in our specific trade, unified by a passion to build a great product that will change the way people discover activities, date ideas, things to do, and life experiences.

Benefits

Health / dental / vision insurance
Activity budget to try items on Vimbly
Unlimited vacation days (just get your work done)
Monthly massage and optional monthly manicure... and they come to you
Monthly social outings (laser tag and paintball? Coming right up...)

items.title: Server Operator (Remote in Europe/Asia region) @ DNSimple
items.content:
Server Operator (Remote in Europe/Asia region) @ DNSimple

2017-12-06 03:52

Description

We are looking for a person to add to our talented server operations staff in the Europe or Asia Pacific regions. You will help us to keep our systems online to deliver the best DNS service to our customers around the world.

Required skills and experience

Chef

We automate everything we can with Chef and their products, having experience with this is the most important requirement.

Open source contributions

Our team contributes a lot to the open source community and we hope you do as well. We would love to see what you've done to help others.

Other skills
  • Empathy and communication; Since we are distributed, we communicate mostly in written form, via pull requests, Slack and with our customers when doing support. Being able to understand and make yourself understood to customers and colleagues is essential.
  • Ability to learn; We manage many different technologies, sometimes in new, innovative ways. We are constantly touching and improving our platform. We celebrate curiosity and creativity.
Job requirements
  • Customer support; Everyone at the company does day to day support to our customers. The operations team is also required to provide support to our internal teams. We appreciate people sensitive to our customer's needs.
  • Remote work; We are remote first and we work asynchronously. We have a team focused environment which requires good collaboration skills, but sometimes you'll need to be able to self drive and work alone, then sync back up for reviews and reporting. Asking lots questions is part of everyone's day to day.
  • Writing documentation; Since we are all async, good caring on documentation is something we all do and value.
  • Travel; We meet up three times a year. We don't require you to go to a conference but we'll support you if you want to speak at one.
  • On-call rotation; Everyone technical (operators and developers) helps with the pager rotation to keep our systems working.
Our Stack

This is the software and systems we deploy and run today. Knowledge and demonstrable skills with any of these are major bonus points.

  • Ubuntu Linux (We're on 14.04 and migrating to 16.04)
  • DataDog (How we submit metrics data to monitor all the things. Metrics/Monitoring experience is a bonus)
  • PostgreSQL (Storing all the data to serve to our internal services)
  • Ruby (Our website and API is built on it along with a few of our operations utilities)
  • GoLang (Used to help ship zone updates to our name servers and perform redirects)
  • Erlang (The beast behind our DNS servers)
  • Nginx and HAProxy (Used heavily to secure and serve our various APIs)
  • Redis (All our stats and background queues to process everything)
  • Python (Used in our DataDog agent to help parse logs and teach it new monitoring tricks)

Country

Anywhere*

Location

Remote in Europe/Asia region

items.title: s Required With Full Stack Skills Work On Modern .NET SQL Server
items.content:
Job description


Voiteq is looking for strong engineers to join our team on a 3-month fixed term contract, working on a range of apps for our software serving the logistics industry. We build apps that use voice-directed work solutions, so there's lots of interesting ways to get involved with working with voice and wearable computers. Analytics is a big part of our business, so any experience working with data warehousing or dashboard tools is a plus.


We are doing more with Android, developing voice recognition apps for use with wearable devices. As a Microsoft Partner we have access to the latest dev tools and platforms for dev and test.


You'll be working as part of cross-functional agile teams, to help to deliver our product roadmap. We have decades of domain experience in-house and we'll use that to help build better products. We use Jira to manage our user stories and take other bits from scrum, like regular standups, code reviews and planning poker sessions.


Culture


Good code is important. We do regular code reviews and run our internal projects on light-touch scrum. We spend the time to get things right. We've invested a lot of effort in our build and deployment tools, using stuff like Jenkins and Octopus and we're moving towards a DevOps way of working. 


Remote Working


We're happy to offer remote working for the right candidates, but would like you to be available to come to a UK office when required, possibly 2-3 times a month.


Learning and Tools


All our developers get a Pluralsight subscription and are expected to make use of it to keep their skills up to date. We believe in giving devs the right tools; all have a DevExpress Ultimate susbcription, i5/i7 workstations with 16gb+ of memory, SSDs and dual widescreen monitors.


Skills & Requirements



  • Proven experience in modern high-level language (ideally C#)

  • Ability to write testable and decoupled code (DI with e.g. Autofac/Moq)

  • Work well in a team and with non-technical people

  • Experience with modern source control (Git)

items.title: Senior Redshift Engineer @ Clevertech
items.content:
Senior Redshift Engineer @ Clevertech

2017-11-24 16:38

Description

DESCRIPTION

Clevertech is looking for a Senior AWS Redshift Engineer to join our global team. We are looking for team members to help us develop world class software products for the most exclusive organizations in the world. We have been at this since 2000, and continue to grow off our best asset, our people.

You are comfortable translating functional and technical requirements into detailed architecture and design in addition to overall system architecture, scalability, reliability, and performance. You are highly experienced with large-scale data analytics and data warehousing. You are able to devise proactive solutions to project-related issues and have stellar communication skills to be able to effectively communicate and inspire trust in all stakeholders.

We will only consider candidates who have worked with petabytes of data in Redshift.

REQUIREMENTS

Clevertech looks for craftsmen developers who take ownership of their code. You can deliver quickly while being clever to avoid missteps. You have an effective positive attitude that shines as you show your care about client and colleague concerns. You are always learning and are a transparent communicator even when it is challenging. You thrive on challenging yourself daily and seek to surround yourself with like minded individuals.

Technically, you have an excellent background with large-scale data structures,highly scalable server architectures and experience with network load balancers and network security. Familiarity with large scale distributed server infrastructure design and development is essential in addition to being comfortable with industry best practices.

BENEFITS

Own Your Time

We are a completely remote team. That means we have a large amount of trust and a lot of flexibility. World travellers, young parents, nature lovers, and commute avoiders love working here. We are a collective of like minded people in over ten countries, and our global perspective shapes our every move.

Focused Work

You will work together on a dedicated team with your eye on one finish line at a time. Our teams are nimble and agile, and cover the technical range you would expect in world class product delivery teams. And keep your eye on the mail - we send out swag everywhere in the world and there are celebratory pictures of Clevertech socks, hoodies, and mugs all over slack.

Learn at your edges

We believe in learning and provide unique programs that improve your tech skills, leadership skills and even challenge you in personal development. CleverFridays, guest speakers, mentorship opportunities and in-depth industry exposure are all on offer here.

And of course, if you speak at a tech conference, we cover all expenses.

Recharge Time

We insist that you take recharge time. We are closed for major holidays and then require that you take at least two weeks a year to refresh.

Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team? Check out why.clevertech.biz

Country

Anywhere

Clevertech looks for craftsmen developers who take ownership of their code. You can deliver quickly while being clever to avoid missteps. You have an effective positive attitude that shines as you show your care about client and colleague concerns. You are always learning and are a transparent communicator even when it is challenging. You thrive on challenging yourself daily and seek to surround yourself with like minded individuals.

Technically, you have an excellent background with large-scale data structures,highly scalable server architectures and experience with network load balancers and network security. Familiarity with large scale distributed server infrastructure design and development is essential in addition to being comfortable with industry best practices.

BENEFITS

Own Your Time

We are a completely remote team. That means we have a large amount of trust and a lot of flexibility. World travellers, young parents, nature lovers, and commute avoiders love working here. We are a collective of like minded people in over ten countries, and our global perspective shapes our every move.

Focused Work

You will work together on a dedicated team with your eye on one finish line at a time. Our teams are nimble and agile, and cover the technical range you would expect in world class product delivery teams. And keep your eye on the mail - we send out swag everywhere in the world and there are celebratory pictures of Clevertech socks, hoodies, and mugs all over slack.

Learn at your edges

We believe in learning and provide unique programs that improve your tech skills, leadership skills and even challenge you in personal development. CleverFridays, guest speakers, mentorship opportunities and in-depth industry exposure are all on offer here.

And of course, if you speak at a tech conference, we cover all expenses.

Recharge Time

We insist that you take recharge time. We are closed for major holidays and then require that you take at least two weeks a year to refresh.

Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team? Check out why.clevertech.biz.

To apply: https://hire.clevertech.biz/job/5a14463d34fce8001ba35594

items.title: Clevertech: Senior Redshift Engineer
items.content:
Full-time

(Anywhere)

DESCRIPTION

Clevertech is looking for a Senior AWS Redshift Engineer to join our global team. We are looking for team members to help us develop world class software products for the most exclusive organizations in the world. We have been at this since 2000, and continue to grow off our best asset, our people.

You are comfortable translating functional and technical requirements into detailed architecture and design in addition to overall system architecture, scalability, reliability, and performance. You are highly experienced with large-scale data analytics and data warehousing. You are able to devise proactive solutions to project-related issues and have stellar communication skills to be able to effectively communicate and inspire trust in all stakeholders.

We will only consider candidates who have worked with petabytes of data in Redshift.

REQUIREMENTS

Clevertech looks for craftsmen developers who take ownership of their code. You can deliver quickly while being clever to avoid missteps. Focused Work

items.title: DevOps Architect at Oracle UK (London, UK) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Role: DevOps, System Administrator
Industry: Cloud-Based Solutions, Enterprise Software
Company size: 10k+ people
Company type: Public

Job description

One of Oracle’s most elite teams, the Product Development Cloud Solution Architects Team (the A-Team), is seeking a DevOps Architect to help strategic customers around the world succeed, implement best practices, provide real world feedback to Product Engineering and Product Management teams, and evangelize Oracle services and products through conferences and blog posts. This is a senior position with high visibility within the company.

You will join an experienced and international team, distributed in over 10 countries. You may work from home, or any Oracle office of your choice. We value and practice daily transparency, supportive feedback loops and direct communication. Team cohesion and helping each other is the core of our nature.

Applications involve the latest technologies, such as Mobile, AR/VR, Intelligent Bots. The team moves as new technologies come up, great career opportunities.

About 50% of the work is coming from the Oracle Executive Technology team, 50% is self-directed and relies on a high sense of initiative from team members to develop the business or investigate new technology trends.

 Desired Skills:

   - Expert-level, real world, experience in CI/CD, unit testing, Docker and Kubernetes

   - Hands-on experience with different Cloud vendors on large-scale deployments

   - Excellent programming skills in Java, Node and/or other relvent languages

   - Strong Agile background (eg. SCRUM/Kanban), able to practice and mentor others

   - Experience with designing large-scale, fault-tolerant distributed systems

   - Ability to quickly create POC and prototypes, including web/mobile front-ends

   - Comfortable with building his/her network within the organization with peers, engage in executive-level communication and handle direct customer interactions

   - Experienced at leading technical teams through discovery, planning, implementation and risk remediation

   - Open-source contribution and public speaking a plus

   - Comfortable working in a distributed team through Slack, emails, conf call; 5-10 days travel per quarter expected

   - 10-20 years of software industry experience is expected

Key highlights:

  - work from home option

  - high-profile team, reporting directly into CTO

  - all the latest tech: Docker, k8, AR/VR, Intelligent Bots

About Oracle UK

With more than 420,000 customers and deployments in more than 145 countries, Oracle offers a comprehensive and fully integrated stack of cloud applications, platform services, and engineered systems.

Benefits

Cycle Scheme
Your Wellbeing, Your Choice Benefits Fund
Access to Car Ownership Scheme
Excellent Learning Opportunities
Childcare Vouchers & Workplace Nursery
Discount Dining Cards
Financial awareness programme and workshops
Pension
Medical coverage
Life Assurance

items.title: Node.js / MySQL developer at Vimbly (New York, NY) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Industry: Recreation & Leisure, Software Development / Engineering, Web Development
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Why join Vimbly?

Vimbly Technologies is a funded and profitable web 2.0 startup looking for a highly motivated, hard-hitting Node.js developer to join the team.  Vimbly Technologies is a fast-paced company focused on creating custom best-in-class, high-performance solutions for enterprises spanning a variety of industries.  At Vimbly, you’ll work side-by-side with proven talent, creative intelligence, and smiley faces (with firm but non-painful handshakes) -- out of our office in the best city in the world, right across from the Empire State Building. Your work will have a direct and meaningful impact on the product. We aren't looking for another cog in the wheel. You will be given significant responsibility and independence. You will be challenged.

Node.js Developer

We are looking for a Node.js developer with a burning curiosity, passion for building great products, track record of writing maintainable code, and reputation of being reliable and efficient.

Candidates able to join our team on-site in our office in Midtown Manhattan are highly preferred, but consideration for remote work will be given to exceptional candidates.  Please indicate your location on your application; applications without location will be ignored.

Responsibilities

  • Work directly with leadership on implementing cutting-edge company initiatives
  • Develop scalable and robust back-end systems (e.g., payment, analytics, scheduling)
  • Work with front-end team to integrate user-facing markup into systems
  • Take ownership of multiple projects and learn new technologies over time

Benefits

  • 100% employer-covered health, dental & vision insurance
  • Unlimited vacation days (just get your work done)
  • Activity budget to try items on Vimbly -- try one, try them all!
  • Personal movie outings (you'll get more pairs of movie tickets than you're able to use -- so you'll know the contrast from a Vimbly activity!)
  • Unlimited Amazon reading budget to buy any book you please
  • Monthly social outings (Laser tag and paintball? Coming right up...)
  • Monthly massage and optional monthly manicure… except they come to you

Skills & Requirements

Requirements

  • Expert-level experience with Node.js and MySQL
  • Deep understanding of Node promises and event loop
  • Basic understanding of front-end development and implementation (HTML5, CSS3, and jQuery)
  • Knowledge of Git version control
  • Exemplary attention to detail
  • Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, or equivalent

Optional Bonus Points

  • Basic knowledge of system administration in Linux and Apache
  • Experience with Angular 2.x / 4.x
  • Experience working with large datasets
  • Experience with process efficiency optimization

About Vimbly

Founded in 2011, Vimbly is a funded web 2.0 startup that lets users find and book recreational activities for free. Our mission is to eliminate hours of research for thousands of activities like tango lessons, intro photography classes, or Italian cooking sessions. All the information is in one place instead of the usual process of Googling, picking nearby locations, checking prices, manually comparing schedules (which are each presented differently), and then exchanging emails to lock it down.

The Vimbly team is a diverse, smart and energetic group of problem solvers.  We are each experts in our specific trade, unified by a passion to build a great product that will change the way people discover activities, date ideas, things to do, and life experiences.

Benefits

Health / dental / vision insurance
Activity budget to try items on Vimbly
Unlimited vacation days (just get your work done)
Monthly massage and optional monthly manicure... and they come to you
Monthly social outings (laser tag and paintball? Coming right up...)

items.title: Redshift DBA Remote - Bigdata Dimension Inc - Remote
items.content:
Redshift DBA Remote
Bigdata Dimension Inc -Remote

Role: AWS Redshift DBA/Architect

US Bachelors is must

Position Description ( 7-10 years of experience) The AWS Redshift DBA/Architect will be responsible for analyzing requirements, prototyping data analysis solutions (primarily in Redshift) , collecting, preparing data for modeling on AWS, create new clusters, proficient in Redshift, specifically database & platform tuning and optimization. Extensive knowledge in configuring Redshift Query Queue’s and ability to capture & interpret database resource utilization both at the database and platform levels. Have expereince or exposure with administration of VM System for Marketing Analytics.

Candidates need to have strong capabilities in large data warehouses using relational and/or Hadoop based systems., UNIX scripting

Required Skills:

  • Must have extensive experience with data implementations, data storage and distribution
  • Data modeling logical and physical
  • Proficient in Redshift, specifically database & platform tuning and optimization. Extensive knowledge in configuring Redshift Query Queue’s and ability to capture & interpret database resource utilization both at the database and platform levels.
  • Optimization and tuning of data structures and queries on Big Data platforms on AWS
  • Data Analysis and data profiling
  • Unix / Shell scripting
  • Oracle database SQL skills
  • Programming experience Java or Scala
  • Excellent Problem Solving and Debugging skills
  • Strong agile development experience
  • Test and maintain applications and test frameworks

Preferred Skills:

  • Understanding of statistics and machine learning
  • Understanding of predictive models
  • Experience interfacing with big data analytics applications like Tableau or analytic stacks like Shark/Spark, or Impala

Education: - Bachelor’s degree in computer science , statistics or related field- Good Communication Skills

Job Type: Full-time

Required education:

  • Bachelor's

Required experience:

  • US Bachelors: 1 year
  • AWS Cluster Development: 1 year
  • Database Tuning: 1 year
  • Redshift DBA: 1 year

Required language:

  • English
